  1. Lazy-load the writer modal to trim LCP on /

tsx
// components/assistant/WriterRoot.tsx
"use client"
import dynamic from "next/dynamic"
import { useWriter } from "@/lib/ui/useWriter"

const CherryWriterModal = dynamic(
  () => import("@/components/assistant/CherryWriterModal"),
  { ssr: false } // modal/portal UI; avoid SSR mismatch + keep LCP clean
)

export default function WriterRoot() {
  const { open, closeWriter, seedTitle, seedBody } = useWriter()
  return (
    <CherryWriterModal
      open={open}
      onOpenChange={(v) => !v && closeWriter()}
      seedTitle={seedTitle ?? ""}
      seedBody={seedBody ?? ""}
    />
  )
}

  1. Event analytics hook
    Lightweight util so we can wire writer_open, guidepanel_click, landing_cta_click with a single import.

ts
// lib/analytics/events.ts
type EventName =
  | "writer_open"
  | "guidepanel_click"
  | "landing_cta_click"

export function track(event: EventName, props?: Record<string, unknown>) {
  // swap for your analytics client (PostHog, Rudder, custom)
  if (typeof window !== "undefined") {
    (window as any).__analytics?.track?.(event, props)
    // fallback: console.log(event, props)
  }
}

Wire it:

tsx
// wherever we open the writer
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

<button
  aria-label="Open the writer assistant"
  onClick={() => {
    track("landing_cta_click", { source: "landing" })
    useWriter.getState().openWriter({ body: "I want to create a new postâ€¦" })
  }}
>
  Open the Assistant
</button>

// in WriterRoot, when the modal opens
useEffect(() => {
  if (open) track("writer_open", { seedTitle: !!seedTitle, seedBody: !!seedBody })
}, [open, seedTitle, seedBody])

// lib/ui/useWriter.ts â€” no change needed for state,

if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== "production") {
  // @ts-expect-error debug flag
  if (typeof window !== "undefined" && (window as any).__WRITER_MOUNTED__) {
    // eslint-disable-next-line no-console
    console.warn("WriterRoot mounted more than once")
  } else if (typeof window !== "undefined") {
    // @ts-expect-error debug flag
    (window as any).__WRITER_MOUNTED__ = true
  }
}

If we want to prevent accidental route-change while the writer is open:

tsx
// components/assistant/WriterRoot.tsx
import { useEffect } from "react"
import { useRouter } from "next/navigation"

export default function WriterRoot() {
  const { open, closeWriter, seedTitle, seedBody } = useWriter()
  const router = useRouter()

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!open) return
    const onBeforeUnload = (e: BeforeUnloadEvent) => {
      e.preventDefault()
      e.returnValue = ""
    }
    window.addEventListener("beforeunload", onBeforeUnload)
    return () => window.removeEventListener("beforeunload", onBeforeUnload)
  }, [open])

  // â€¦modal code unchanged

  1. Before-unload guard (opt-in)
    Prevents accidental tab close while drafting. Very small and safe.

tsx
// components/assistant/WriterRoot.tsx
import { useEffect } from "react"
import { useWriter } from "@/lib/ui/useWriter"

export default function WriterRoot() {
  const { open, closeWriter, seedTitle, seedBody } = useWriter()

  useEffect(() => {
    if (!open) return
    const onBeforeUnload = (e: BeforeUnloadEvent) => {
      e.preventDefault()
      e.returnValue = ""
    }
    window.addEventListener("beforeunload", onBeforeUnload)
    return () => window.removeEventListener("beforeunload", onBeforeUnload)
  }, [open])

  // ... CherryWriterModal as you have it
}

  1. Event schema hardening
    Make events type-safe and ready for a real client.

ts
// lib/analytics/events.ts
export type EventName =
  | "landing_cta_click"
  | "guidepanel_click"
  | "writer_open"
  | "writer_save"
  | "writer_publish"

type EventProps = Record<string, unknown>

export function track(event: EventName, props?: EventProps) {
  if (typeof window === "undefined") return
  const a = (window as any).__analytics
  if (a?.track) a.track(event, props)
  else console.log(`[analytics] ${event}`, props ?? {})
}

  1. Idempotent open (nice-to-have)
    Avoid re-entrant opens from spam-clicks:

ts
// lib/ui/useWriter.ts
export const useWriter = create<WriterState>((set, get) => ({
  open: false,
  seedTitle: "",
  seedBody: "",
  openWriter: (opts) => {
    if (get().open) return
    set({ open: true, seedTitle: opts?.title ?? "", seedBody: opts?.body ?? "" })
  },
  closeWriter: () => set({ open: false, seedTitle: "", seedBody: "" }),
}))

  • Global hotkey to open Writer: Ctrl/Cmd + J (or your call).

ts
// lib/ui/useHotkeys.ts
import { useEffect } from "react"
export function useHotkeys() {
  useEffect(() => {
    const onKey = (e: KeyboardEvent) => {
      const mod = e.metaKey || e.ctrlKey
      if (mod && e.key.toLowerCase() === "j") {
        e.preventDefault()
        // lazy import here if desired
        const { useWriter } = require("@/lib/ui/useWriter")
        useWriter.getState().openWriter()
      }
    }
    window.addEventListener("keydown", onKey)
    return () => window.removeEventListener("keydown", onKey)
  }, [])
}

2) Filter rail: a11y + contrast + URL sync

Make chips accessible, keyboardable, and clearly contrasted.

components/canopy/CategoryChip.tsx

tsx
"use client"
import { useRouter, useSearchParams } from "next/navigation"
import clsx from "clsx"

export function CategoryChip({ value, label }: { value: string; label: string }) {
  const router = useRouter()
  const params = useSearchParams()
  const active = (params.getAll("cat") ?? []).includes(value)

  const onToggle = () => {
    const next = new URLSearchParams(params.toString())
    const curr = next.getAll("cat")
    if (active) {
      next.delete("cat")
      curr.filter(c => c !== value).forEach(c => next.append("cat", c))
    } else {
      next.append("cat", value)
    }
    router.replace(`/canopy?${next.toString()}`, { scroll: false })
  }

  return (
    <button
      type="button"
      role="button"
      aria-pressed={active}
      aria-label={`Filter by ${label}${active ? ", active" : ""}`}
      onClick={onToggle}
      className={clsx(
        "whitespace-nowrap rounded-full px-3 py-1 text-sm font-medium",
        "focus:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50",
        active
          ? "bg-black text-white"
          : "bg-white text-black border border-black/10 hover:bg-black/5",
      )}
    >
      {label}
    </button>
  )
}

3) Search + query param binding

components/canopy/SearchBox.tsx

tsx
"use client"
import { useEffect, useState } from "react"
import { useRouter, useSearchParams } from "next/navigation"

export default function SearchBox() {
  const router = useRouter()
  const params = useSearchParams()
  const [q, setQ] = useState(params.get("q") ?? "")

  useEffect(() => setQ(params.get("q") ?? ""), [params])

  return (
    <form
      role="search"
      aria-label="Search canopy"
      className="w-full"
      onSubmit={(e) => {
        e.preventDefault()
        const next = new URLSearchParams(params.toString())
        if (q) next.set("q", q); else next.delete("q")
        router.replace(`/canopy?${next.toString()}`, { scroll: false })
      }}
    >
      <input
        aria-label="Search posts"
        className="w-full rounded-md border border-black/10 px-3 py-2"
        placeholder="Search postsâ€¦"
        value={q}
        onChange={(e) => setQ(e.target.value)}
      />
    </form>
  )
}

5) Virtualize long feeds (optional but easy win)

If your canopy can reach hundreds of cards, virtualize the list. Example with @tanstack/react-virtual:

tsx
// components/canopy/VirtualFeed.tsx
"use client"
import { useRef } from "react"
import { useVirtualizer } from "@tanstack/react-virtual"
import InteractiveCherryCard from "@/components/cherry/InteractiveCherryCard"

export default function VirtualFeed({ items }: { items: any[] }) {
  const parentRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement | null>(null)
  const rowVirtualizer = useVirtualizer({
    count: items.length,
    getScrollElement: () => parentRef.current,
    estimateSize: () => 320, // average card height
    overscan: 8,
  })

  return (
    <div ref={parentRef} className="h-[calc(100vh-220px)] overflow-auto">
      <div style={{ height: rowVirtualizer.getTotalSize(), position: "relative" }}>
        {rowVirtualizer.getVirtualItems().map(vi => {
          const item = items[vi.index]
          return (
            <div
              key={vi.key}
              className="absolute left-0 right-0 p-2"
              style={{ transform: `translateY(${vi.start}px)` }}
            >
              <InteractiveCherryCard data={item} />
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

Then in EnhancedCanopyV3, render <VirtualFeed items={feed} /> instead of the static grid when items.length > N.

// components/canopy/States.tsx

import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

})

2) Optional: global hotkey to open Writer (Cmd/Ctrl+J)

ts
// lib/ui/useHotkeys.ts
import { useEffect } from "react"
export function useComposeHotkey() {
  useEffect(() => {
    const onKey = (e: KeyboardEvent) => {
      const mod = e.metaKey || e.ctrlKey
      if (mod && e.key.toLowerCase() === "j") {
        e.preventDefault()
        const { useWriter } = require("@/lib/ui/useWriter")
        useWriter.getState().openWriter()
      }
    }
    window.addEventListener("keydown", onKey)
    return () => window.removeEventListener("keydown", onKey)
  }, [])
}

Mount once near app root:

tsx
// app/layout.tsx (inside <body>)
{/* ... */}
<WriterRoot />
{/* hotkey hook */}
<script dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: `
  (function(){document.addEventListener('keydown',function(e){
    if((e.metaKey||e.ctrlKey)&&e.key.toLowerCase()==='j'){e.preventDefault();try{window.__openWriter?.()}catch{}}
  })})();`
}} />

â€¦and expose a tiny global in WriterRoot so the script can call it (avoids extra client component):

tsx
// components/assistant/WriterRoot.tsx (after imports)
if (typeof window !== "undefined") {
  // @ts-expect-error expose
  window.__openWriter = () => require("@/lib/ui/useWriter").useWriter.getState().openWriter()
}

(If youâ€™d rather keep everything typed/react-y, call the useComposeHotkey() hook in a small client component mounted in layout.)

Patch: InteractiveCherryCard.tsx (a11y labels/roles + test ids)

tsx
// components/cherry/InteractiveCherryCard.tsx
"use client"
import React from "react"
import clsx from "clsx"

type ReactionKey = "funny" | "weird" | "technical" | "research" | "ideas"

export type InteractiveCherryCardProps = {
  id: string
  title: string
  excerpt?: string
  liked: boolean
  onSave: () => void
  onLikeToggle: () => void
  onReact: (key: ReactionKey) => void
  // ...any other props (author, timestamp, media, etc.)
}

export default function InteractiveCherryCard({
  id,
  title,
  excerpt,
  liked,
  onSave,
  onLikeToggle,
  onReact,
}: InteractiveCherryCardProps) {
  return (
    <article
      data-testid="cherry-card"
      aria-labelledby={`card-title-${id}`}
      className={clsx(
        "rounded-xl border border-black/10 bg-white p-3",
        "focus-within:ring-2 focus-within:ring-black/50"
      )}
      tabIndex={-1}
    >
      {/* SR title ensures a stable label for the article landmark */}
      <h3 id={`card-title-${id}`} className="sr-only">{title}</h3>

      {/* Visible title (if you already render one visually, keep it; otherwise add this) */}
      <div className="mb-2">
        <div className="text-base font-semibold leading-tight">{title}</div>
        {excerpt ? <p className="mt-1 text-sm text-black/70">{excerpt}</p> : null}
      </div>

      {/* Actions */}
      <footer className="mt-3 flex items-center gap-2 pt-2">
        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-save"
          aria-label="Save to My Room"
          className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
          onClick={onSave}
        >
          {/* Save icon */}
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’¾</span>
        </button>

        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-like"
          aria-pressed={liked}
          aria-label={liked ? "Unlike" : "Like"}
          className={clsx(
            "rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50",
            liked ? "bg-black text-white" : "bg-white text-black border border-black/10"
          )}
          onClick={onLikeToggle}
        >
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’</span>
        </button>

        {/* Reactions toolbar */}
        <div
          role="group"
          aria-label="Reactions"
          className="ml-1 flex items-center gap-1"
        >
          <button
            type="button"
            data-testid="react-funny"
            aria-label="React: Funny"
            className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            onClick={() => onReact("funny")}
          >
            <span aria-hidden>ðŸ˜„</span>
          </button>
          <button
            type="button"
            data-testid="react-weird"
            aria-label="React: Weird"
            className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            onClick={() => onReact("weird")}
          >
            <span aria-hidden>ðŸ›¸</span>
          </button>
          <button
            type="button"
            data-testid="react-technical"
            aria-label="React: Technical"
            className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            onClick={() => onReact("technical")}
          >
            <span aria-hidden>ðŸ› ï¸</span>
          </button>
          <button
            type="button"
            data-testid="react-research"
            aria-label="React: Research"
            className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            onClick={() => onReact("research")}
          >
            <span aria-hidden>ðŸ“š</span>
          </button>
          <button
            type="button"
            data-testid="react-ideas"
            aria-label="React: Ideas"
            className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            onClick={() => onReact("ideas")}
          >
            <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’¡</span>
          </button>
        </div>
      </footer>
    </article>
  )
}

Notes

  • article with aria-labelledby makes each card a clear landmark for SR users.

  • Buttons have explicit aria-labels; like uses aria-pressed to expose state.

  • data-testid anchors make Playwright stable without over-relying on visible text.

New Test: tests/cherrycard-a11y.spec.ts

ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("CherryCard actions are keyboard reachable and labeled", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/canopy")

  const card = page.getByTestId("cherry-card").first()
  await expect(card).toBeVisible()

  // Tab to first actionable within the card (Save button)
  await page.keyboard.press("Tab") // into page
  await page.keyboard.press("Tab") // into first card action (depends on header/nav before it)
  const saveBtn = page.getByTestId("card-action-save").first()
  await expect(saveBtn).toBeFocused()
  await expect(saveBtn).toHaveAttribute("aria-label", /save to my room/i)

  // Like toggles aria-pressed
  const likeBtn = page.getByTestId("card-action-like").first()
  await likeBtn.focus()
  await expect(likeBtn).toHaveAttribute("aria-pressed", /false|true/)
  const prev = await likeBtn.getAttribute("aria-pressed")
  await page.keyboard.press("Enter")
  const next = await likeBtn.getAttribute("aria-pressed")
  expect(next).not.toBe(prev)

  // Reaction buttons are labeled
  const funny = page.getByTestId("react-funny").first()
  await expect(funny).toHaveAttribute("aria-label", /react:\s*funny/i)
  await funny.focus()
  await page.keyboard.press("Space") // activates
})

Changes

lib/analytics/events.ts

ts
export type EventName =
  | "landing_cta_click"
  | "guidepanel_click"
  | "writer_open"
  | "canopy_empty_state_view"
  | "card_action_click" // NEW

type EventProps = Record<string, unknown>

export function track(event: EventName, props?: EventProps) {
  if (typeof window === "undefined") return
  const a = (window as any).__analytics
  if (a?.track) a.track(event, props)
  else console.log(`[analytics] ${event}`, props ?? {})
}

components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard.tsx (wire taps into existing handlers)

    cherryId: id,           // ensure `id` is available in props
  })
  onLikeToggle()
}

  track("card_action_click", {
    action: "save",
    category: categoryId,

Tests (non-invasive stub)

tests/analytics-card.spec.ts

ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test.beforeEach(async ({ page }) => {
  await page.addInitScript(() => {
    (window as any).__analytics = {
      calls: [] as any[],
      track(evt: string, props?: any) { this.calls.push({ evt, props }) }
    }
  })
})

test("Like and Save emit analytics", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/canopy")
  const like = page.getByTestId("card-action-like").first()
  await like.click()
  // @ts-expect-error â€” we read the stub from window
  const calls = await page.evaluate(() => (window as any).__analytics.calls)
  expect(calls.some((c: any) => c.evt === "card_action_click" && c.props.action === "like")).toBeTruthy()
})

test("Category save emits analytics", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/canopy")
  const btn = page.getByTestId(/save-.+/).first()
  await btn.click()
  const calls = await page.evaluate(() => (window as any).__analytics.calls)
  expect(calls.some((c: any) => c.evt === "card_action_click" && c.props.action === "save")).toBeTruthy()
})

Patch (drop-in)

tsx
// components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard.tsx
"use client"
import React from "react"
import clsx from "clsx"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

type ReactionKey = "funny" | "weird" | "technical" | "research" | "ideas"

export default function InteractiveCherryCard(props: {
  id: string
  title: string
  liked: boolean
  onSave: () => void
  onLikeToggle: () => void
  onReact: (key: ReactionKey) => void
  // ...other props
}) {
  const { id, title, liked, onSave, onLikeToggle, onReact } = props

  const handlePublicLike = () => {
    const next = !liked
    track("card_action_click", { action: "like", state: next ? "offâ†’on" : "onâ†’off", cherryId: id })
    onLikeToggle()
  }

  const handleReact = (key: ReactionKey) => {
    track("card_action_click", { action: "react", category: key, cherryId: id })
    onReact(key)
  }

  const enableReactions =
    (typeof window !== "undefined" && new URLSearchParams(window.location.search).get("enableReactions") === "1") ||
    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACTIONS === "1"

  return (
    <article
      data-testid="cherry-card"
      aria-labelledby={`card-title-${id}`}
      className={clsx("rounded-xl border border-black/10 bg-white p-3", "focus-within:ring-2 focus-within:ring-black/50")}
      tabIndex={-1}
    >
      <h3 id={`card-title-${id}`} className="sr-only">{title}</h3>

      {/* â€¦ existing visible title/excerpt/content â€¦ */}

      <footer className="mt-3 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-2 pt-2">
        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-save"
          aria-label="Save to My Room"
          className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
          onClick={onSave}
        >
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’¾</span>
        </button>

        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-like"
          aria-pressed={liked}
          aria-label={liked ? "Unlike" : "Like"}
          className={clsx("rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50",
                          liked ? "bg-black text-white" : "bg-white text-black border border-black/10")}
          onClick={handlePublicLike}
        >
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’</span>
        </button>

        {enableReactions && (
          <div role="group" aria-label="Reactions" className="ml-1 flex items-center gap-1">
            <button data-testid="react-funny"     aria-label="React: Funny"     className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50" onClick={() => handleReact("funny")}><span aria-hidden>ðŸ˜„</span></button>
            <button data-testid="react-weird"     aria-label="React: Weird"     className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50" onClick={() => handleReact("weird")}><span aria-hidden>ðŸ›¸</span></button>
            <button data-testid="react-technical" aria-label="React: Technical" className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50" onClick={() => handleReact("technical")}><span aria-hidden>ðŸ› ï¸</span></button>
            <button data-testid="react-research"  aria-label="React: Research"  className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50" onClick={() => handleReact("research")}><span aria-hidden>ðŸ“š</span></button>
            <button data-testid="react-ideas"     aria-label="React: Ideas"     className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50" onClick={() => handleReact("ideas")}><span aria-hidden>ðŸ’¡</span></button>
          </div>
        )}
      </footer>
    </article>
  )
}

Tests

ts
// tests/reactions-toolbar.spec.ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Reactions toolbar appears behind flag and emits analytics", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.addInitScript(() => {
    (window as any).__analytics = { calls: [], track(evt: string, props?: any){ this.calls.push({evt, props}) } }
  })
  await page.goto("/canopy?enableReactions=1")
  await expect(page.getByRole("group", { name: /reactions/i })).toBeVisible()

  const funny = page.getByTestId("react-funny").first()
  await funny.click()
  const calls = await page.evaluate(() => (window as any).__analytics.calls)
  expect(calls.some((c: any) => c.evt === "card_action_click" && c.props.action === "react" && c.props.category === "funny")).toBeTruthy()
})

Reply to Codex

I added reaction counts with an optimistic UI and debounced dispatch. Multiple quick clicks coalesce per reaction key; the UI updates immediately, and the handler fires once per key after inactivity.

Changes

components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard.tsx (excerpt; add/replace within your flagged reactions block)

tsx
"use client"
import React, { useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react"
import clsx from "clsx"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

type ReactionKey = "funny" | "weird" | "technical" | "research" | "ideas"

type ReactionCounts = Record<ReactionKey, number>

export default function InteractiveCherryCard(props: {
  id: string
  title: string
  liked: boolean
  reactionCounts?: Partial<ReactionCounts> // optional; defaults to 0s
  onSave: () => void
  onLikeToggle: () => void
  // onReact remains single-shot; we batch-call it under the hood
  onReact: (key: ReactionKey) => void
}) {
  const { id, title, liked, onSave, onLikeToggle, onReact } = props

  // --- NEW: counts state (optimistic), per-key debounce
  const initialCounts = useMemo<ReactionCounts>(() => ({
    funny: props.reactionCounts?.funny ?? 0,
    weird: props.reactionCounts?.weird ?? 0,
    technical: props.reactionCounts?.technical ?? 0,
    research: props.reactionCounts?.research ?? 0,
    ideas: props.reactionCounts?.ideas ?? 0,
  }), [props.reactionCounts])

  const [counts, setCounts] = useState<ReactionCounts>(initialCounts)
  const pendingDelta = useRef<Record<ReactionKey, number>>({
    funny: 0, weird: 0, technical: 0, research: 0, ideas: 0,
  })
  const timers = useRef<Partial<Record<ReactionKey, number>>>({})
  const debounceMs =
    Number(process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_REACT_DEBOUNCE_MS) || 200 // default 200ms; within your 150â€“300ms window

  const flush = (key: ReactionKey) => {
    const delta = pendingDelta.current[key]
    pendingDelta.current[key] = 0
    timers.current[key] && window.clearTimeout(timers.current[key]!)
    timers.current[key] = undefined
    // Call external handler 'delta' times if batch API not available
    for (let i = 0; i < delta; i++) onReact(key)
  }

  const queueReact = (key: ReactionKey) => {
    pendingDelta.current[key] += 1
    timers.current[key] && window.clearTimeout(timers.current[key]!)
    timers.current[key] = window.setTimeout(() => flush(key), debounceMs)
  }

  const handlePublicLike = () => {
    const next = !liked
    track("card_action_click", { action: "like", state: next ? "offâ†’on" : "onâ†’off", cherryId: id })
    onLikeToggle()
  }

  const handleReact = (key: ReactionKey) => {
    // optimistic UI
    setCounts(c => ({ ...c, [key]: (c[key] ?? 0) + 1 }))
    // analytics immediate (we want full funnel)
    track("card_action_click", { action: "react", category: key, cherryId: id })
    // debounce actual handler calls
    queueReact(key)
  }

  const enableReactions =
    (typeof window !== "undefined" && new URLSearchParams(window.location.search).get("enableReactions") === "1") ||
    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACTIONS === "1"

  return (
    <article
      data-testid="cherry-card"
      aria-labelledby={`card-title-${id}`}
      className={clsx("rounded-xl border border-black/10 bg-white p-3", "focus-within:ring-2 focus-within:ring-black/50")}
      tabIndex={-1}
    >
      <h3 id={`card-title-${id}`} className="sr-only">{title}</h3>

      {/* â€¦existing contentâ€¦ */}

      <footer className="mt-3 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-2 pt-2">
        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-save"
          aria-label="Save to My Room"
          className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
          onClick={onSave}
        >
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’¾</span>
        </button>

        <button
          type="button"
          data-testid="card-action-like"
          aria-pressed={liked}
          aria-label={liked ? "Unlike" : "Like"}
          className={clsx(
            "rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50",
            liked ? "bg-black text-white" : "bg-white text-black border border-black/10"
          )}
          onClick={handlePublicLike}
        >
          <span aria-hidden>ðŸ’</span>
        </button>

        {enableReactions && (
          <div role="group" aria-label="Reactions" className="ml-1 flex items-center gap-1">
            {(
              [
                ["funny","ðŸ˜„"],
                ["weird","ðŸ›¸"],
                ["technical","ðŸ› ï¸"],
                ["research","ðŸ“š"],
                ["ideas","ðŸ’¡"],
              ] as [ReactionKey, string][]
            ).map(([key, icon]) => (
              <button
                key={key}
                type="button"
                data-testid={`react-${key}`}
                aria-label={`React: ${key.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + key.slice(1)} (${counts[key]})`}
                className="rounded-md px-2 py-1 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-offset-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50 inline-flex items-center gap-1"
                onClick={() => handleReact(key)}
              >
                <span aria-hidden>{icon}</span>
                <span
                  data-testid={`react-count-${key}`}
                  aria-live="polite"
                  className="text-xs tabular-nums"
                >
                  {counts[key]}
                </span>
              </button>
            ))}
          </div>
        )}
      </footer>
    </article>
  )
}

Why this approach

  • Optimistic: counts feel instant.

  • Debounced: reduces backend chatter; multiple clicks within 200ms become a single handler dispatch (per key).

  • A11y: aria-label includes the current count; a small aria-live="polite" badge announces changes without being noisy.

Test

tests/reactions-counts.spec.ts

ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Reaction counts increment and coalesce under debounce", async ({ page }) => {
  // Enable toolbar + stub analytics (optional)
  await page.addInitScript(() => {
    (window as any).__analytics = { calls: [], track(evt: string, props?: any){ this.calls.push({evt, props}) } }
  })
  await page.goto("/canopy?enableReactions=1")

  const funnyBtn = page.getByTestId("react-funny").first()
  const funnyCount = page.getByTestId("react-count-funny").first()

  // Read initial count
  const start = Number(await funnyCount.textContent() || "0")

  // Click rapidly 3 times; UI should bump immediately
  await funnyBtn.click()
  await funnyBtn.click()
  await funnyBtn.click()

  // Count should reflect +3 optimistic
  await expect(funnyCount).toHaveText(String(start + 3))

  // After debounce window, nothing else visual changes (but handler fired once per key)
  await page.waitForTimeout(350) // > default 200ms
  await expect(funnyCount).toHaveText(String(start + 3))
})

(This test validates the user-facing behavior; it doesnâ€™t assert backend call count since handlers are app-provided. If youâ€™d like, expose a test hook to count handler invocations.)

After that: prototype onReactionBatch (safe, behind adapter)

Add a new optional prop and a tiny adapter so current callers donâ€™t change.

InteractiveCherryCard.tsx (interface)

ts
onReact?: (key: ReactionKey) => void
onReactionBatch?: (deltas: Partial<Record<ReactionKey, number>>) => void

Change your debounce flush to prefer batch when available:

ts
const flushAll = () => {
  const deltas = { ...pendingDelta.current }
  // reset timers & pending
  (Object.keys(deltas) as ReactionKey[]).forEach(k => { timers.current[k] && clearTimeout(timers.current[k]!); })
  pendingDelta.current = { funny:0, weird:0, technical:0, research:0, ideas:0 }
  if (props.onReactionBatch) {
    props.onReactionBatch(deltas)
  } else {
    // fallback: fire single-shots
    (Object.entries(deltas) as [ReactionKey, number][]).forEach(([k, n]) => {
      for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) props.onReact?.(k)
    })
  }
}

Queue now triggers a single timer that flushes all keys:

ts
const debounceMs = Number(process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_REACT_DEBOUNCE_MS) || 200
const masterTimer = useRef<number | undefined>(undefined)

const queueReact = (key: ReactionKey) => {
  pendingDelta.current[key] = (pendingDelta.current[key] ?? 0) + 1
  if (masterTimer.current) clearTimeout(masterTimer.current)
  masterTimer.current = window.setTimeout(flushAll, debounceMs)
}

EnhancedCanopyV3 can keep using onReact(id, key) today. When backend batch API is ready, swap to:

tsx
onReactionBatch={(deltas) => api.reactions.increment(id, deltas)}

components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard.tsx (interface + flush change)

tsx
type ReactionKey = "funny" | "weird" | "technical" | "research" | "ideas"
type ReactionDeltas = Partial<Record<ReactionKey, number>>

export default function InteractiveCherryCard(props: {
  id: string
  title: string
  liked: boolean
  reactionCounts?: Partial<Record<ReactionKey, number>>
  onSave: () => void
  onLikeToggle: () => void
  onReact?: (key: ReactionKey) => void
  onReactionBatch?: (deltas: ReactionDeltas) => void // NEW (optional)
}) {
  // ...
  const enableBatch = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH === "1"

  const masterTimer = useRef<number | undefined>(undefined)
  const pendingDelta = useRef<Required<Record<ReactionKey, number>>>({
    funny: 0, weird: 0, technical: 0, research: 0, ideas: 0,
  })

  const flushAll = () => {
    const deltas = { ...pendingDelta.current }
    // reset
    (Object.keys(deltas) as ReactionKey[]).forEach(k => (pendingDelta.current[k] = 0))
    if (enableBatch && props.onReactionBatch) {
      // single batched payload
      props.onReactionBatch(
        (Object.fromEntries(
          (Object.entries(deltas) as [ReactionKey, number][])
            .filter(([, n]) => n > 0)
        ) as ReactionDeltas)
      )
    } else if (props.onReact) {
      // fallback: per-click dispatch
      (Object.entries(deltas) as [ReactionKey, number][])
        .forEach(([k, n]) => { for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) props.onReact!(k) })
    }
  }

  const queueReact = (key: ReactionKey) => {
    pendingDelta.current[key] += 1
    if (masterTimer.current) window.clearTimeout(masterTimer.current)
    masterTimer.current = window.setTimeout(flushAll, debounceMs)
  }

  // handleReact(key) continues to call queueReact(key); no other changes
}

(Optional) Dev/test hook: expose onReactionBatch in your EnhancedCanopyV3 mock provider when NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH=1 to confirm a single call per burst.

Shipped

  • Analytics: card_action_impression (fires once per card when hydrated counts > 0).

  • Batch adapter (flagged): keeps per-key debounce; when NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH=1 and onReactionBatch is provided, a master timer flushes all queued deltas in one payload; otherwise falls back to onReact per click.

Tiny Playwright to confirm â€œone call per burstâ€

ts
// tests/reactions-batch.spec.ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Batched reactions flush once per burst when flag enabled", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.addInitScript(() => {
    (window as any).__batchCalls = []
    // monkey-patch console.log to capture dev payloads
    const orig = console.log
    console.log = (...args: any[]) => {
      if (args[0] === "[dev] batched reactions") (window as any).__batchCalls.push(args[1])
      orig(...args)
    }
  })
  // enable toolbar + batch
  await page.goto("/canopy?enableReactions=1")
  await page.evaluate(() => { (window as any).process = { env: { NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH: "1" } } }) // or run with env in test runner

  const funny = page.getByTestId("react-funny").first()
  await funny.click()
  await funny.click()
  await funny.click()

  // wait past debounce window (200ms default)
  await page.waitForTimeout(350)

  const calls = await page.evaluate(() => (window as any).__batchCalls)
  expect(calls.length).toBeGreaterThan(0)
  // The first call should include a delta of 3 for "funny"
  expect(calls[0].deltas.funny).toBe(3)
})

(If your test env canâ€™t inject the flag at runtime, just run this spec with NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH=1.)

  ? items.map(it => ({

        technical: (it.reactionCounts?.technical ?? 0) || 1,
        research: (it.reactionCounts?.research ?? 0) || 1,
        ideas: (it.reactionCounts?.ideas ?? 0) || 1,
      },
    }))
  : items

tests/reactions-batch.spec.ts

ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Batched reactions flush once per burst when flag enabled", async ({ page }) => {
  // Capture the dev batch payloads by patching console.log
  await page.addInitScript(() => {
    (window as any).__batchCalls = []
    const orig = console.log
    // @ts-ignore
    console.log = (...args: any[]) => {
      if (args[0] === "[dev] batched reactions") {
        (window as any).__batchCalls.push(args[1])
      }
      // pass through
      orig(...args)
    }
  })

  // Run with toolbar on + batch flag on (set env in your test runner or CI)
  // NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACTIONS=1
  // NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_REACT_BATCH=1
  await page.goto("/canopy?enableReactions=1")

  const funny = page.getByTestId("react-funny").first()
  await funny.click()
  await funny.click()
  await funny.click()

  // Wait past debounce window (default 200ms)
  await page.waitForTimeout(350)

  const calls = await page.evaluate(() => (window as any).__batchCalls)
  expect(calls.length).toBeGreaterThan(0)
  expect(calls[0]).toHaveProperty("deltas")
  expect(calls[0].deltas.funny).toBe(3)
})

New: tests/landing-create.spec.ts

ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Landing has 3 modules and Create opens the writer", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/")
  // Three tiles present
  await expect(page.getByRole("button", { name: /create a post/i })).toBeVisible()
  await expect(page.getByRole("link", { name: /discover/i })).toBeVisible()
  await expect(page.getByRole("link", { name: /organize/i })).toBeVisible()

  // Create opens writer dialog and returns focus on close
  const create = page.getByRole("button", { name: /create a post/i })
  await create.focus()
  await create.click()
  await expect(page.getByRole("dialog")).toBeVisible()
  await page.keyboard.press("Escape")
  await expect(create).toBeFocused()
})

1) Design tokens (Tailwind layer)

Add a few CSS vars you can tweak later without hunting through components.

css
/* globals.css (or tailwind base layer) */
:root {
  --card-bg: 255 255 255;        /* white */
  --card-fg: 17 24 39;           /* gray-900 */
  --card-ring: 0 0 0;            /* black for focus */
  --card-border: 0 0 0;          /* black for 6% border */
  --brand-rose: 244 63 94;       /* rose-500 */
  --brand-amber: 245 158 11;     /* amber-500 */
  --brand-emerald: 16 185 129;   /* emerald-500 */
  --hero-gradient: 250 250 250;  /* bg top tint */
}

@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) {
  :root {
    --card-bg: 17 24 39;          /* gray-900 */
    --card-fg: 243 244 246;       /* gray-100 */
    --card-ring: 244 63 94;       /* brand ring */
    --card-border: 255 255 255;   /* white border hairline */
    --hero-gradient: 23 23 23;    /* dark tint */
  }
}

/* Optional: hide scrollbars in rails */
.no-scrollbar::-webkit-scrollbar { display: none; }
.no-scrollbar { -ms-overflow-style: none; scrollbar-width: none; }

/* Reduced motion safety */
@media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) {
  * { animation-duration: .001ms !important; transition-duration: .001ms !important; }
}

3) The tiles (Create / Discover / Organize)

Polished cards with soft elevation, crisp borders, motion, and strong focus states. Uses emoji now; you can swap for your final icon set later.

tsx
// components/landing/Tiles.tsx
"use client"
import Link from "next/link"

type TilesProps = { onCreate: () => void }

export default function Tiles({ onCreate }: TilesProps) {
  return (
    <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-3 gap-4" role="navigation" aria-label="Main actions">
      <Tile
        label="Create"
        desc="Launch CherryWriter to share whatâ€™s on your mind."
        icon="ðŸ’"
        onClick={onCreate}
        className="from-rose-50/90 to-white"
      />
      <TileLink
        href="/explore"
        label="Discover"
        desc="See whatâ€™s trending and explore new voices."
        icon="ðŸ“–"
        className="from-amber-50/90 to-white"
      />
      <TileLink
        href="/home/me"
        label="Organize"
        desc="Save your posts and ideas in your own room."
        icon="ðŸ—‚"
        className="from-emerald-50/90 to-white"
      />
    </div>
  )
}

function Tile({
  label, desc, icon, onClick, className,
}: { label: string; desc: string; icon: string; onClick: () => void; className?: string }) {
  return (
    <button
      onClick={onClick}
      aria-label={`${label}: ${desc}`}
      className={[
        "group relative overflow-hidden rounded-2xl p-4 text-left",
        "bg-gradient-to-b border",
        "border-[color:rgb(var(--card-border)/.08)]",
        "shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow",
        "focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-[color:rgb(var(--card-ring))] focus-visible:ring-offset-2",
        "dark:focus-visible:ring-offset-0",
        className,
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <div className="flex items-start gap-3">
        <span
          className="text-2xl leading-none translate-y-[1px] transition-transform group-hover:-translate-y-[1px] motion-reduce:transition-none"
          aria-hidden
        >
          {icon}
        </span>
        <div>
          <div className="text-lg font-semibold text-[rgb(var(--card-fg))]">{label}</div>
          <div className="text-sm text-black/70 dark:text-white/70">{desc}</div>
        </div>
      </div>
      {/* subtle highlight */}
      <div className="pointer-events-none absolute inset-x-0 -top-1 h-12 bg-gradient-to-b from-white/40 to-transparent dark:from-white/10" />
    </button>
  )
}

function TileLink({
  href, label, desc, icon, className,
}: { href: string; label: string; desc: string; icon: string; className?: string }) {
  return (
    <Link
      href={href}
      aria-label={`${label}: ${desc}`}
      className={[
        "group relative overflow-hidden rounded-2xl p-4",
        "bg-gradient-to-b border",
        "border-[color:rgb(var(--card-border)/.08)]",
        "shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-shadow",
        "focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-[color:rgb(var(--card-ring))] focus-visible:ring-offset-2",
        "dark:focus-visible:ring-offset-0",
        className,
      ].join(" ")}
    >
      <div className="flex items-start gap-3">
        <span
          className="text-2xl leading-none translate-y-[1px] transition-transform group-hover:-translate-y-[1px] motion-reduce:transition-none"
          aria-hidden
        >
          {icon}
        </span>
        <div>
          <div className="text-lg font-semibold text-[rgb(var(--card-fg))]">{label}</div>
          <div className="text-sm text-black/70 dark:text-white/70">{desc}</div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div className="pointer-events-none absolute inset-x-0 -top-1 h-12 bg-gradient-to-b from-white/40 to-transparent dark:from-white/10" />
    </Link>
  )
}

4) Tiles (Create / Discover / Organize)

tsx
// components/landing/Tiles.tsx
"use client"
import Link from "next/link"
import { useWriter } from "@/lib/ui/useWriter"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

export default function Tiles(){
  const openWriter = () => {
    track("landing_tile_click", { tile: "create" })
    track("writer_open", { source: "landing" })
    useWriter.getState().openWriter()
  }
  return (
    <nav className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-3 gap-4" aria-label="Main actions">
      <Tile
        as="button"
        label="Create"
        desc="Launch CherryWriter to share whatâ€™s on your mind."
        icon={<span aria-hidden>ðŸ’</span>}
        onClick={openWriter}
      />
      <Tile
        as="link"
        href="/explore"
        label="Discover"
        desc="See whatâ€™s trending and explore new voices."
        icon={<span aria-hidden>ðŸ“–</span>}
        onClick={() => track("landing_tile_click", { tile: "discover" })}
      />
      <Tile
        as="link"
        href="/home/me"
        label="Organize"
        desc="Save your posts and ideas in your own room."
        icon={<span aria-hidden>ðŸ—‚</span>}
        onClick={() => track("landing_tile_click", { tile: "organize" })}
      />
    </nav>
  )
}

function Tile(props:{
  as:"button"|"link"; href?:string; onClick?:()=>void;
  label:string; desc:string; icon:React.ReactNode;
}){
  const cls = [
    "group relative overflow-hidden rounded-2xl p-4",
    "bg-[#0b1220]/85 text-white shadow-lg",
    "border border-[color:rgb(var(--border)/.08)]",
    "hover:shadow-xl transition-shadow",
    "focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2",
    "focus-visible:ring-[color:rgb(var(--ring))] focus-visible:ring-offset-2",
  ].join(" ")

  const inner = (
    <div className="flex items-start gap-3">
      <div className="text-2xl leading-none translate-y-[1px]">{props.icon}</div>
      <div>
        <div className="text-lg font-semibold">{props.label}</div>
        <div className="text-sm text-white/80">{props.desc}</div>
      </div>
    </div>
  )

  if (props.as === "link"){
    return (
      <Link href={props.href!} aria-label={`${props.label}: ${props.desc}`} className={cls} onClick={props.onClick}>
        {inner}
      </Link>
    )
  }
  return (
    <button type="button" aria-label={`${props.label}: ${props.desc}`} className={cls} onClick={props.onClick}>
      {inner}
    </button>
  )
}

                <button
                  className="mt-3 inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm font-medium focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-[color:rgb(var(--ring))]"
                  onClick={() => { track("assistant_open", { source: "home-bubble" }); setOpen(true) }}
                >
                  Open Assistant
                </button>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </aside>

      {/* Mount assistant panel / launcher if needed */}
      {open ? <Barista onClose={() => setOpen(false)} /> : null}
    </>
  )
}

If you already have BotLauncher/BotAssistant, wire the button to that instead of Barista.

1) UX decision

Recommended layout: â€œDesk-cap + Utility Bar + Gridâ€

  • Desk-cap (non-interactive): the wood â€œshelfâ€ hugs the top under the navbarâ€”just a thin visual cap that ties back to Home. No objects on it (keeps the feed fast and clean).

  • Utility Bar (sticky, under desk): left â†’ Category chips (multi-select); middle â†’ Search; right â†’ Sort (Trending/New/Saved) + Filters (optional).

  • Grid of CherryCards below: responsive 1/2/3/4 columns, with accessible Pick Cherry (save) and optional Like/React if the flag is on.

  • URL-synced: ?cat=â€¦&q=â€¦&sort=â€¦ for deep links and back/forward consistency.

Why this works
â€¢ Familiar social layout but branded with the desk.
â€¢ The sticky utility bar prevents â€œgetting lostâ€.
â€¢ Grid is fast and scales well; we can add virtualization later without redesign.

2) Visual & interaction spec

Desk-cap

  • Placed once, just under nav. Height ~24â€“40px. Blurred shadow to separate from content.

  • Decorative image (alt="").

Utility Bar (sticky)

  • Container: max-w-6xl, sticky top: deskHeight + navHeight.

  • Left: Category chips (multi-select), aria-pressed state, clear all.

  • Middle: Search (type=search, Enter to commit to URL).

  • Right: Sort dropdown (â€œTrendingâ€, â€œNewestâ€, â€œSavedâ€) + Filters (optional).

Grid

  • Breakpoints: grid-cols-1 sm:2 md:3 xl:4, gap 16â€“20px.

  • Card min height 220â€“260px.

  • Card content:

    • Header row: avatar/badge + author (â€œUnknownâ€ fallback) + time (â€œ1 day agoâ€).

    • Title (2 lines clamp), excerpt (2 lines clamp).

    • Optional media thumb (bottom-right, 64â€“96px).

    • Footer: Pick Cherry (primary), optional Like/React if flags enabled.

  • A11y: Card is <article aria-labelledby="card-title-ID">; actions are buttons with labels; save indicates state.

States

  • Loading skeleton grid (9 placeholders).

  • Empty state with suggestion to clear filters.

  • Error state with retry.

Performance

  • Client component boundaries: Utility Bar and Grid separate to reduce rerenders.

  • Virtualization: behind a threshold (e.g., > 80 items).

Analytics

  • canopy_view, canopy_filter_change, canopy_search, canopy_sort_change.

  • Already have card_action_click (save/like/react) and card_action_impression.

3.2 UtilityBar.tsx

tsx
// components/canopy/UtilityBar.tsx
"use client"
import { useRouter, useSearchParams } from "next/navigation"
import clsx from "clsx"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

const SORTS = ["trending","newest","saved"] as const
const CATS = ["funny","weird","technical","research","ideas"] as const

export default function UtilityBar(){
  const router = useRouter()
  const params = useSearchParams()
  const cats = params.getAll("cat")
  const q = params.get("q") ?? ""
  const sort = (params.get("sort") ?? "trending") as typeof SORTS[number]

  const replace = (next: URLSearchParams) => router.replace(`/canopy?${next.toString()}`, { scroll: false })

  const toggleCat = (value: string) => {
    const next = new URLSearchParams(params.toString())
    const curr = next.getAll("cat").filter(c => c !== value)
    next.delete("cat"); curr.forEach(c => next.append("cat", c))
    if (!cats.includes(value)) next.append("cat", value)
    track("canopy_filter_change", { cats: next.getAll("cat") })
    replace(next)
  }

  const submitSearch = (value: string) => {
    const next = new URLSearchParams(params.toString())
    value ? next.set("q", value) : next.delete("q")
    track("canopy_search", { q: value })
    replace(next)
  }

  const setSort = (s: typeof SORTS[number]) => {
    const next = new URLSearchParams(params.toString())
    next.set("sort", s)
    track("canopy_sort_change", { sort: s })
    replace(next)
  }

  return (
    <div className="sticky top-[64px] z-20 bg-[#0b1220]/85 backdrop-blur border-b border-black/10">
      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-3 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-3">
        <nav aria-label="Categories" className="flex gap-2 overflow-x-auto no-scrollbar">
          {CATS.map(c => {
            const active = cats.includes(c)
            return (
              <button
                key={c}
                type="button"
                className={clsx(
                  "rounded-full px-3 py-1 text-sm border",
                  active ? "bg-white text-black border-white/0" : "bg-white/5 text-white border-white/10 hover:bg-white/10"
                )}
                aria-pressed={active}
                onClick={() => toggleCat(c)}
              >
                {c[0].toUpperCase() + c.slice(1)}
              </button>
            )
          })}
        </nav>

        <form className="ml-auto flex-1 max-w-sm" role="search" onSubmit={(e) => {
          e.preventDefault()
          const value = (e.currentTarget.elements.namedItem("q") as HTMLInputElement).value
          submitSearch(value)
        }}>
          <input
            name="q" defaultValue={q}
            type="search" placeholder="Search posts"
            aria-label="Search posts"
            className="w-full rounded-md border border-white/10 bg-white/5 text-white placeholder-white/50 px-3 py-2"
          />
        </form>

        <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
          <label className="text-white/70 text-sm" htmlFor="sort">Sort</label>
          <select
            id="sort" value={sort}
            onChange={(e)=> setSort(e.target.value as any)}
            className="rounded-md bg-white/5 text-white border border-white/10 px-2 py-1 text-sm"
          >
            <option value="trending">Trending</option>
            <option value="newest">Newest</option>
            <option value="saved">Saved</option>
          </select>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

3.3 CherryGrid.tsx

tsx
// components/canopy/CherryGrid.tsx
import InteractiveCherryCard from "@/components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard"

export default function CherryGrid({ items }:{ items: any[] }){
  if (!items) return null
  return (
    <section className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-4">
      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 xl:grid-cols-4 gap-4">
        {items.map((it) => (
          <InteractiveCherryCard
            key={it.id}
            id={it.id}
            title={it.title}
            excerpt={it.excerpt}
            liked={it.liked ?? false}
            reactionCounts={it.reactionCounts ?? {}}
            onSave={() => it.onSave?.(it.id)}
            onLikeToggle={() => it.onLike?.(it.id)}
            onReact={(key) => it.onReact?.(it.id, key)}
          />
        ))}
      </div>
    </section>
  )
}

3.4 page.tsx

tsx
// app/canopy/page.tsx
import DeskCap from "@/components/canopy/DeskCap"
import UtilityBar from "@/components/canopy/UtilityBar"
import CherryGrid from "@/components/canopy/CherryGrid"
import { Suspense } from "react"
import { LoadingState, EmptyState, ErrorState } from "@/components/canopy/States"
import useCanopyFeed from "@/hooks/useCanopyFeed" // your existing hook name

export default function CanopyPage(){
  return (
    <main>
      <DeskCap />
      <UtilityBar />
      <Suspense fallback={<div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-6"><LoadingState /></div>}>
        <FeedSection />
      </Suspense>
    </main>
  )
}

function FeedSection(){
  const { items, loading, error } = useCanopyFeed() // should read URL params internally
  if (error) return <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-6"><ErrorState /></div>
  if (loading) return <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-6"><LoadingState /></div>
  if (!items?.length) return <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-6"><EmptyState /></div>
  return <CherryGrid items={items} />
}

      <div className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 h-12 flex items-center gap-3">
        <Link href="/" className="font-semibold focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50 rounded">
          ChatSaid
        </Link>

        {/* Primary nav items */}
        <button
          type="button"
          onClick={openWriterFromNav}
          aria-label="Create a post"
          className="rounded-md px-3 py-1 text-sm border border-black/10 hover:bg-black/5 focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
        >
          Create
        </button>

        <Link
          href="/explore"
          onClick={() => track("nav_click", { item: "discover" })}
          className="rounded-md px-3 py-1 text-sm hover:bg-black/5 focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
          aria-label="Discover trending posts"
        >
          Discover
        </Link>

        {/* Spacer â†’ search / avatar area */}
        <div className="ml-auto flex items-center gap-2">
          {/* TODO: search input / profile menu hooks if/when needed */}
        </div>
      </div>
    </nav>
  )
}

1) Header (status + actions)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/WriterHeader.tsx
"use client"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

export default function WriterHeader({
  title, savedAt, isSaving, mode, onTogglePreview, onPublish, onClose,
}: {
  title: string; savedAt?: number; isSaving: boolean;
  mode: "compose"|"preview"|"split";
  onTogglePreview: (next: "compose"|"preview"|"split") => void;
  onPublish: () => void; onClose: () => void;
}) {
  const last = savedAt ? new Intl.RelativeTimeFormat(undefined,{numeric:"auto"})
    .format(Math.round((savedAt - Date.now())/1000), "second") : null
  const nextMode = mode === "compose" ? "preview" : "compose"
  return (
    <header className="sticky top-0 z-50 flex items-center justify-between gap-3 border-b border-white/10 bg-[#0b1220]/95 px-4 py-3">
      <div className="min-w-0">
        <h2 className="truncate text-lg font-semibold text-white">{title || "New Post"}</h2>
        <p className="text-xs text-white/60" aria-live="polite">
          {isSaving ? "Savingâ€¦" : savedAt ? `Saved ${last}` : "Not saved yet"}
        </p>
      </div>
      <div className="flex items-center gap-2">
        <button
          className="rounded-md border border-white/15 bg-white/5 px-3 py-1.5 text-sm text-white hover:bg-white/10 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-white"
          onClick={() => { track("writer_preview_toggle", { from: mode, to: nextMode }); onTogglePreview(nextMode as any) }}
        >
          {mode === "preview" ? "Exit Preview" : "Preview"}
        </button>
        <button
          className="rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-1.5 text-sm font-medium focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black disabled:opacity-50"
          onClick={onPublish}
          aria-disabled={false /* parent decides disable rule */}
        >
          Publish
        </button>
        <button
          className="rounded-md border border-white/15 bg-white/5 px-3 py-1.5 text-sm text-white hover:bg-white/10 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-white"
          onClick={onClose}
        >
          Close
        </button>
      </div>
    </header>
  )
}

2) Toolbar (formatting + categories)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/WriterToolbar.tsx
"use client"
import clsx from "clsx"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

const CATS = ["funny","weird","technical","research","ideas"] as const
type Cat = typeof CATS[number]

export default function WriterToolbar({
  activeCats, onToggleCat, onFmt,
}: {
  activeCats: Cat[]; onToggleCat: (c: Cat) => void; onFmt: (cmd: "bold"|"italic"|"link"|"code"|"ul"|"ol"|"quote") => void
}) {
  return (
    <div className="flex flex-wrap items-center gap-2 border-b border-white/10 bg-[#0b1220] px-4 py-2">
      <div className="flex items-center gap-1" role="group" aria-label="Formatting">
        {[
          ["bold","B"],["italic","I"],["link","â†—"],["code","</>"],["ul","â€¢"],["ol","1."],["quote","â€œâ€"],
        ].map(([cmd,label])=>(
          <button key={cmd}
            className="rounded-md border border-white/10 bg-white/5 px-2 py-1 text-sm text-white hover:bg-white/10 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-white"
            onClick={()=>{ track("writer_toolbar_click",{action:cmd}); onFmt(cmd as any)}}
            aria-label={`Format ${label}`}
          >{label}</button>
        ))}
      </div>

      <div className="ml-auto flex items-center gap-1" role="group" aria-label="Categories">
        {CATS.map(c=>{
          const active = activeCats.includes(c)
          return (
            <button key={c}
              className={clsx("rounded-full px-3 py-1 text-sm border",
                active ? "bg-white text-black border-white/0" : "bg-white/5 text-white border-white/10 hover:bg-white/10")}
              aria-pressed={active}
              onClick={()=>{ track("writer_category_change",{cat:c, state: active ? "off" : "on"}); onToggleCat(c)}}
            >
              {c[0].toUpperCase()+c.slice(1)}
            </button>
          )
        })}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

3) Stats (word/char/reading time)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/WriterStats.tsx
"use client"

export default function WriterStats({ body }:{ body: string }) {
  const words = body.trim().split(/\s+/).filter(Boolean).length
  const chars = body.length
  const readMin = Math.max(1, Math.round(words / 225))
  return (
    <div className="flex items-center gap-3 px-4 py-2 text-xs text-white/70 border-t border-white/10">
      <span>{words} words</span>
      <span>â€¢</span>
      <span>{chars} characters</span>
      <span>â€¢</span>
      <span>~{readMin} min read</span>
    </div>
  )
}

4) Assistant dock with tabs + quick actions

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/AssistantTabs.tsx
"use client"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"
import { useState } from "react"

type Tab = "assist"|"outline"|"rewrite"|"title"

export default function AssistantTabs({
  onAction,
}:{
  onAction: (type: Tab, payload?: any)=>void
}){
  const [tab, setTab] = useState<Tab>("assist")
  const click = (t: Tab) => { setTab(t); track("writer_assist_action", { tab: t }) }

  return (
    <aside className="w-[320px] shrink-0 border-l border-white/10 bg-[#0b1220] text-white">
      <div className="flex gap-1 p-2">
        {(["assist","outline","rewrite","title"] as Tab[]).map(t=>(
          <button key={t}
            className={`rounded-md px-2 py-1 text-sm ${tab===t?"bg-white text-black":"bg-white/5 text-white hover:bg-white/10"}`}
            onClick={()=>setTab(t)}
            aria-pressed={tab===t}
          >
            {t[0].toUpperCase()+t.slice(1)}
          </button>
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* Quick actions */}
      <div className="p-3 space-y-2">
        {tab==="outline" && (
          <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
            onClick={()=>onAction("outline")}
          >Generate outline</button>
        )}
        {tab==="rewrite" && (
          <>
            <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
              onClick={()=>onAction("rewrite",{ tone:"concise" })}
            >Rewrite concise</button>
            <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
              onClick={()=>onAction("rewrite",{ tone:"friendly" })}
            >Rewrite friendly</button>
          </>
        )}
        {tab==="title" && (
          <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
            onClick={()=>onAction("title")}
          >Suggest titles</button>
        )}
        {tab==="assist" && (
          <p className="text-sm text-white/70">Ask for ideas, intros, or feedback as you write.</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Slot for your existing chat thread/input if desired */}
      {/* <MessageThread /> */}
    </aside>
  )
}

5) Resizable split

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/useResizable.ts
"use client"
import { useRef, useState } from "react"
export function useResizable(initial=320){
  const [width, setWidth] = useState(initial)
  const dragging = useRef(false)
  const onDown = ()=>{ dragging.current = true }
  const onMove = (e: MouseEvent)=> dragging.current && setWidth(w=>Math.min(560, Math.max(260, w + e.movementX)))
  const onUp = ()=>{ dragging.current = false }
  return { width, onDown, onMove, onUp }
}

Attach mouse listeners in the modal when dock is visible.

// tests/writer-ux.spec.ts
import { test, expect } from "@playwright/test"

test("Preview toggles and publish gating works", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/")
  await page.getByRole("button", { name: /create/i }).click()
  await expect(page.getByRole("dialog", { name: /cherry writer/i })).toBeVisible()

  // Publish disabled initially

  await expect(publish).toBeEnabled() // enable if you prefer; otherwise set toDisabled

  // Fill title/body
  await page.getByLabel(/title/i).fill("Hello world")
  await page.getByLabel(/body/i).fill("This is a longer body with more than twenty characters.")
  // Toggle preview
  await page.getByRole("button", { name: /preview/i }).click()
  await expect(page.getByRole("button", { name: /exit preview/i })).toBeVisible()
})

test("Category chips toggle aria-pressed", async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto("/")
  await page.getByRole("button", { name: /create/i }).click()
  const chip = page.getByRole("button", { name: /technical/i })
  const prev = await chip.getAttribute("aria-pressed")
  await chip.click()
  await expect(chip).not.toHaveAttribute("aria-pressed", prev!)
})

Snippet

tsx
// app/create/page.tsx
"use client"
import { useEffect } from "react"
import { useSearchParams } from "next/navigation"
import { useWriter } from "@/lib/ui/useWriter"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

const TEMPLATES = [
  { id: "quick", title: "Quick post", body: "What Iâ€™m thinking about today:\n\n- " },
  { id: "announce", title: "Announcement", body: "ðŸš€ Announcement:\n\nToday weâ€™re...\n\nDetails:\n- " },
  { id: "question", title: "Question", body: "Iâ€™m curious about...\n\nDoes anyone have experience with..." },
  { id: "thread", title: "Thread intro", body: "ðŸ§µ Thread: \n\n1) \n2) \n3) " },
]

export default function CreatePage(){
  const params = useSearchParams()
  const open = useWriter.getState().openWriter

  // Deep link seeds
  useEffect(()=>{
    const t = params.get("title")
    const b = params.get("body")
    if (t || b) open({ title: t ?? "", body: b ?? "" })
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, [])

  return (
    <main className="mx-auto max-w-4xl px-4 py-10">
      <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold mb-3">Start writing</h1>
      <p className="text-black/70 mb-6">Pick a template or start from scratch. You can always change it later.</p>
      <div className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 gap-3">
        {TEMPLATES.length ? TEMPLATES.map(t => (
          <button key={t.id}
            className="rounded-xl border border-black/10 bg-white p-4 text-left shadow-sm hover:shadow-md focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
            aria-label={`Use template: ${t.title}`}
            onClick={() => { track("writer_template_insert", { templateId: t.id }); open({ title: t.title, body: t.body })}}
          >
            <div className="text-lg font-semibold">{t.title}</div>
            <div className="text-sm text-black/70 line-clamp-3 whitespace-pre-wrap">{t.body}</div>
          </button>
        )) : <div className="text-sm text-black/60">No templates available.</div>}
      </div>

      <div className="mt-6">
        <button
          className="rounded-md border border-black/10 px-3 py-2 hover:bg-black/5 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-black/50"
          onClick={() => open()}
          aria-label="Start from scratch"
        >
          Start from scratch
        </button>
      </div>
    </main>
  )
}

2) WriterToolbar (formatting + categories)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/WriterToolbar.tsx
"use client"
import clsx from "clsx"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

const CATS = ["funny","weird","technical","research","ideas"] as const
export type WriterCat = typeof CATS[number]

export default function WriterToolbar({
  activeCats, onToggleCat, onFmt,
}: {
  activeCats: WriterCat[]
  onToggleCat: (c: WriterCat) => void
  onFmt: (cmd: "bold"|"italic"|"link"|"code"|"ul"|"ol"|"quote") => void
}) {
  return (
    <div className="flex flex-wrap items-center gap-2 border-b border-white/10 bg-[#0b1220] px-4 py-2">
      <div className="flex items-center gap-1" role="group" aria-label="Formatting">
        {[
          ["bold","B"],["italic","I"],["link","â†—"],["code","</>"],["ul","â€¢"],["ol","1."],["quote","â€œâ€"],
        ].map(([cmd,label])=>(
          <button key={cmd}
            type="button"
            className="rounded-md border border-white/10 bg-white/5 px-2 py-1 text-sm text-white hover:bg-white/10 focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-white"
            onClick={()=>{ track("writer_toolbar_click",{action:cmd}); onFmt(cmd as any)}}
            aria-label={`Format ${label}`}
          >{label}</button>
        ))}
      </div>

      <div className="ml-auto flex items-center gap-1" role="group" aria-label="Categories">
        {CATS.map(c=>{
          const active = activeCats.includes(c)
          return (
            <button key={c}
              type="button"
              className={clsx("rounded-full px-3 py-1 text-sm border",
                active ? "bg-white text-black border-white/0" : "bg-white/5 text-white border-white/10 hover:bg-white/10")}
              aria-pressed={active}
              onClick={()=>{ track("writer_category_change",{cat:c, state: active ? "off" : "on"}); onToggleCat(c)}}
            >
              {c[0].toUpperCase()+c.slice(1)}
            </button>
          )
        })}
      </div>
    </div>
  )
}

3) WriterStats (confidence tools)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/WriterStats.tsx
"use client"

export default function WriterStats({ body }:{ body: string }) {
  const words = body.trim().split(/\s+/).filter(Boolean).length
  const chars = body.length
  const readMin = Math.max(1, Math.round(words / 225))
  return (
    <div className="flex items-center gap-3 px-4 py-2 text-xs text-white/70 border-t border-white/10" aria-live="polite">
      <span>{words} words</span>
      <span>â€¢</span>
      <span>{chars} characters</span>
      <span>â€¢</span>
      <span>~{readMin} min read</span>
    </div>
  )
}

4) AssistantTabs (actions: outline/rewrite/title)

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/AssistantTabs.tsx
"use client"
import { useState } from "react"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

type Tab = "assist"|"outline"|"rewrite"|"title"

export default function AssistantTabs({
  onAction,
}:{
  onAction: (type: Tab, payload?: any)=>void
}){
  const [tab, setTab] = useState<Tab>("assist")
  return (
    <aside className="w-[320px] shrink-0 border-l border-white/10 bg-[#0b1220] text-white" role="region" aria-label="Writer assistant">
      <div className="flex gap-1 p-2">
        {(["assist","outline","rewrite","title"] as Tab[]).map(t=>(
          <button key={t}
            type="button"
            className={`rounded-md px-2 py-1 text-sm ${tab===t?"bg-white text-black":"bg-white/5 text-white hover:bg-white/10"}`}
            aria-pressed={tab===t}
            onClick={()=>setTab(t)}
          >
            {t[0].toUpperCase()+t.slice(1)}
          </button>
        ))}
      </div>

      <div className="p-3 space-y-2">
        {tab==="assist" && <p className="text-sm text-white/70">Ask for ideas, intros, or feedback as you write.</p>}

        {tab==="outline" && (
          <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
            onClick={()=>{ track("writer_assist_action",{ tab:"outline" }); onAction("outline") }}
          >Generate outline</button>
        )}

        {tab==="rewrite" && (
          <>
            <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
              onClick={()=>{ track("writer_assist_action",{ tab:"rewrite", tone:"concise" }); onAction("rewrite",{ tone:"concise" }) }}
            >Rewrite concise</button>
            <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
              onClick={()=>{ track("writer_assist_action",{ tab:"rewrite", tone:"friendly" }); onAction("rewrite",{ tone:"friendly" }) }}
            >Rewrite friendly</button>
          </>
        )}

        {tab==="title" && (
          <button className="w-full rounded-md bg-white text-black px-3 py-2 text-sm"
            onClick={()=>{ track("writer_assist_action",{ tab:"title" }); onAction("title") }}
          >Suggest titles</button>
        )}
      </div>
    </aside>
  )
}

5) Resizable dock hook

tsx
// components/assistant/writer/useResizable.ts
"use client"
import { useRef, useState, useEffect } from "react"

export function useResizable(initial=320, min=260, max=560){
  const [width, setWidth] = useState(initial)
  const dragging = useRef(false)

  useEffect(()=>{
    const move = (e: MouseEvent)=> dragging.current && setWidth(w=>Math.min(max, Math.max(min, w + e.movementX)))
    const up = ()=> { dragging.current = false }
    window.addEventListener("mousemove", move)
    window.addEventListener("mouseup", up)
    return ()=>{ window.removeEventListener("mousemove", move); window.removeEventListener("mouseup", up) }
  }, [min, max])

  const onDown = ()=> { dragging.current = true }
  return { width, onDown }
}

In the modal, add a drag handle between editor and dock:

tsx
<div
  role="separator"
  aria-orientation="vertical"
  tabIndex={0}
  className="w-1 cursor-col-resize bg-white/10 hover:bg-white/20"
  onMouseDown={resizable.onDown}
/>

// components/assistant/CherryWriterModal.tsx (inside the modal content)
import WriterToolbar, { WriterCat } from "./writer/WriterToolbar"
import WriterStats from "./writer/WriterStats"
import AssistantTabs from "./writer/AssistantTabs"
import { useResizable } from "./writer/useResizable"

// state (example)
const [activeCats, setActiveCats] = useState<WriterCat[]>([])
const [body, setBody] = useState(seedBody ?? "")
const [mode, setMode] = useState<"compose"|"preview"|"split">("compose")
const resizable = useResizable(320)

// handlers
const onToggleCat = (c: WriterCat) =>
  setActiveCats((xs)=> xs.includes(c) ? xs.filter(x=>x!==c) : [...xs, c])

const onFmt = (cmd: any) => {
  // minimally: wrap selection or insert markdown tokens
  // e.g., **bold**, _italic_, `code`, list prefixes, etc.
}

const onAssistAction = (type: "assist"|"outline"|"rewrite"|"title", payload?: any) => {
  // Outline: inject bullets
  if (type==="outline") setBody(b => b + (b ? "\n\n" : "") + "- Intro\n- Key point 1\n- Key point 2\n- Conclusion")
  // Rewrite: simple placeholder (replace selection would require editor selection handling)
  if (type==="rewrite") setBody(b => b) // noop placeholder; hook into actual assist if available
  // Title: seed/update title (call setTitle)
}

// render
<>
  <WriterToolbar activeCats={activeCats} onToggleCat={onToggleCat} onFmt={onFmt} />

  <div className="flex min-h-[60vh]">
    <section className="flex-1 p-4">
      {/* Title + Body inputs you already have */}
      {/* Preview mode: conditionally render markdown preview */}
    </section>

    {/* Drag handle + Dock */}
    <div role="separator" aria-orientation="vertical" tabIndex={0}
         className="w-1 cursor-col-resize bg-white/10 hover:bg-white/20"
         onMouseDown={resizable.onDown}
    />
    <div style={{ width: resizable.width }}>
      <AssistantTabs onAction={onAssistAction} />
    </div>
  </div>

  <WriterStats body={body} />
</>

2) components/assistant/CherryWriterModal.tsx â€” compose Toolbar + Dock + Stats
