tsx
// components/assistant/CherryWriterModal.tsx
"use client"
import { useEffect, useMemo, useRef, useState } from "react"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"
import WriterToolbar, { type WriterCat } from "./writer/WriterToolbar"
import WriterStats from "./writer/WriterStats"
import AssistantTabs from "./writer/AssistantTabs"
import { useResizable } from "./writer/useResizable"

// ... your existing imports (Dialog, header, etc.)

export default function CherryWriterModal(props: {
  open: boolean
  onOpenChange: (v: boolean) => void
  seedTitle?: string
  seedBody?: string
  onPublish?: (payload: { title: string; body: string; categories: WriterCat[] }) => void
}) {
  const { open, onOpenChange, seedTitle = "", seedBody = "", onPublish } = props

  // title/body state (reuse your own if present)
  const [title, setTitle] = useState(seedTitle)
  const [body, setBody] = useState(seedBody)

  // NEW: writer mode + categories
  const [mode, setMode] = useState<"compose" | "preview" | "split">("compose")
  const [activeCats, setActiveCats] = useState<WriterCat[]>([])

  // Save state (reuse your autosave if you already have it)
  const [isSaving, setIsSaving] = useState(false)
  const [savedAt, setSavedAt] = useState<number | undefined>(undefined)

  // Resizable assistant dock
  const resizable = useResizable(320, 260, 560)

  // Body textarea ref ensures selection-safe formatting
  const bodyRef = useRef<HTMLTextAreaElement | null>(null)

  // --- Formatting: clean, selection-aware markdown-ish commands
  const onFmt = (cmd: "bold" | "italic" | "link" | "code" | "ul" | "ol" | "quote") => {
    const el = bodyRef.current
    if (!el) return
    const v = el.value
    const s = el.selectionStart ?? 0
    const e = el.selectionEnd ?? 0
    const sel = v.slice(s, e)

    const insert = (text: string) => v.slice(0, s) + text + v.slice(e)
    const wrap = (l: string, r: string = l) => v.slice(0, s) + l + sel + r + v.slice(e)

    let next = v
    let cursorPos = e

    switch (cmd) {
      case "bold":
        next = wrap("**")
        cursorPos = sel ? s + 2 + sel.length + 2 : s + 2
        break
      case "italic":
        next = wrap("_")
        cursorPos = sel ? s + 1 + sel.length + 1 : s + 1
        break
      case "code":
        next = wrap("`")
        cursorPos = sel ? s + 1 + sel.length + 1 : s + 1
        break
      case "link": {
        const text = sel || "text"
        const link = `[${text}](https://)`
        next = insert(link)
        // place cursor inside URL
        const urlStart = s + 1 + text.length + 2 // [ + text + ](
        cursorPos = urlStart + 8 // after https://
        break
      }
      case "ul": {
        const block = sel || ""
        const lines = block ? block.split("\n") : [""]
        const bulleted = lines.map(l => (l.startsWith("- ") ? l : `- ${l}`)).join("\n")
        next = insert(bulleted)
        cursorPos = s + 2
        break
      }
      case "ol": {
        const block = sel || ""
        const lines = block ? block.split("\n") : [""]
        const numbered = lines.map((l, i) => (l.match(/^\d+\. /) ? l : `${i + 1}. ${l}`)).join("\n")
        next = insert(numbered)
        cursorPos = s + 3
        break
      }
      case "quote": {
        const block = sel || ""
        const lines = block ? block.split("\n") : [""]
        const quoted = lines.map(l => (l.startsWith("> ") ? l : `> ${l}`)).join("\n")
        next = insert(quoted)
        cursorPos = s + 2
        break
      }
    }

    setBody(next)
    // restore selection/cursor on next frame for smooth typing
    requestAnimationFrame(() => {
      el.focus()
      el.setSelectionRange(cursorPos, cursorPos)
    })
  }

  const onToggleCat = (c: WriterCat) =>
    setActiveCats(xs => (xs.includes(c) ? xs.filter(x => x !== c) : [...xs, c]))

  const onAssistAction = (type: "assist" | "outline" | "rewrite" | "title", payload?: any) => {
    // Outline: simple helpful scaffold
    if (type === "outline") {
      setBody(b => b + (b ? "\n\n" : "") + "- Intro\n- Key point 1\n- Key point 2\n- Conclusion")
    }
    // Rewrite/Title: leave stubbed; wire to LLM later
    if (type === "rewrite") {
      setBody(b => b) // placeholder, no-op
    }
    if (type === "title") {
      // setTitle(t) later when you have suggestions
    }
  }

  // --- Autosave demo (hook into your existing debounced save)
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!open) return
    setIsSaving(true)
    const t = setTimeout(() => {
      setIsSaving(false)
      setSavedAt(Date.now())
      // fire writer_save on autosave complete (optional)
      // track("writer_save", { autosave: true })
    }, 800)
    return () => clearTimeout(t)
  }, [title, body, activeCats, open])

  const publishDisabled = title.trim().length < 3 || body.trim().length < 20

  // Render (omit your Dialog/Modal wrapper for brevity; place this inside the dialog body)
  return (
    /* ... your Dialog root + header (showing title, saving state, preview/publish/close) ... */
    <>
      <WriterToolbar activeCats={activeCats} onToggleCat={onToggleCat} onFmt={onFmt} />

      <div className="flex min-h-[60vh]">
        {/* Compose / Preview area */}
        <section className="flex-1 p-4">
          {/* Title */}
          <label className="sr-only" htmlFor="writer-title">Title</label>
          <input
            id="writer-title"
            aria-label="Title"
            className="w-full rounded-md border border-white/10 bg-white/5 px-3 py-2 text-white placeholder-white/50 mb-3"
            placeholder="Give it a titleâ€¦"
            value={title}
            onChange={(e) => setTitle(e.target.value)}
          />

          {/* Body */}
          {mode !== "preview" ? (
            <>
              <label className="sr-only" htmlFor="writer-body">Body</label>
              <textarea
                id="writer-body"
                name="body"
                aria-label="Body"
                ref={bodyRef}
                className="min-h-[38vh] w-full rounded-md border border-white/10 bg-white/5 px-3 py-2 text-white placeholder-white/50"
                placeholder="Whatâ€™s on your mind?"
                value={body}
                onChange={(e) => setBody(e.target.value)}
              />
            </>
          ) : (
            <div
              className="prose prose-invert max-w-none"
              // Replace with your real markdown renderer if present
              dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: simpleMarkdownPreview(title, body) }}
            />
          )}
        </section>

        {/* Separator + Dock */}
        <div
          role="separator"
          aria-orientation="vertical"
          tabIndex={0}
          className="w-1 cursor-col-resize bg-white/10 hover:bg-white/20"
          onMouseDown={resizable.onDown}
        />
        <div style={{ width: resizable.width }}>
          <AssistantTabs onAction={onAssistAction} />
        </div>
      </div>

      <WriterStats body={body} />

      {/* Your header buttons should call these: */}
      {/* Preview toggle example:
          track("writer_preview_toggle", { from: mode, to: mode === "preview" ? "compose" : "preview" });
          setMode(m => (m === "preview" ? "compose" : "preview"))
      */}
      {/* Publish example:
          if (!publishDisabled) {
            track("writer_publish", { categories: activeCats, length: body.length })
            onPublish?.({ title, body, categories: activeCats })
          }
      */}
    </>
  )
}

// super-light preview (swap with your real renderer)
function simpleMarkdownPreview(title: string, body: string) {
  const esc = (s: string) => s.replace(/[&<>"']/g, m => ({ "&":"&amp;","<":"&lt;",">":"&gt;",'"':"&quot;","'":"&#39;" }[m] as string))
  const md = esc(body)
    .replace(/^### (.*)$/gm, "<h3>$1</h3>")
    .replace(/^## (.*)$/gm, "<h2>$1</h2>")
    .replace(/^# (.*)$/gm, "<h1>$1</h1>")
    .replace(/\*\*(.+?)\*\*/g, "<strong>$1</strong>")
    .replace(/_(.+?)_/g, "<em>$1</em>")
    .replace(/`(.+?)`/g, "<code>$1</code>")
    .replace(/^\> (.*)$/gm, "<blockquote>$1</blockquote>")
    .replace(/^\- (.*)$/gm, "<li>$1</li>")
    .replace(/^\d+\. (.*)$/gm, "<li>$1</li>")
    .replace(/\[(.+?)\]\((https?:\/\/[^\s)]+)\)/g, `<a href="$2" target="_blank" rel="noopener">$1</a>`)
    .replace(/(?:\r?\n){2,}/g, "</p><p>")
  return `<h1>${esc(title || "New Post")}</h1><p>${md}</p>`
}

2) Backend hooks: save/publish + LLM outline/rewrite/title

A) Client helpers (minimal)

lib/api/client.ts

ts
export async function apiJSON<T>(url:string, init?:RequestInit):Promise<T>{
  const res = await fetch(url, { headers:{ "Content-Type":"application/json" }, ...init })
  if (!res.ok) throw new Error(`${res.status} ${res.statusText}`)
  return res.json() as Promise<T>
}

lib/api/posts.ts

ts
import { apiJSON } from "./client"

export type PostPayload = { title:string; body:string; categories:string[] }

export async function saveDraft(payload: PostPayload){
  return apiJSON<{ id:string; savedAt:number }>("/api/posts/draft", { method:"POST", body: JSON.stringify(payload) })
}

export async function publishPost(payload: PostPayload){
  return apiJSON<{ id:string; url:string }>("/api/posts/publish", { method:"POST", body: JSON.stringify(payload) })
}

lib/api/assist.ts

ts
import { apiJSON } from "./client"

export async function getOutline(body:string){
  return apiJSON<{ bullets:string[] }>("/api/assist/outline", { method:"POST", body: JSON.stringify({ body }) })
}

export async function rewrite(body:string, tone:"concise"|"friendly"){
  return apiJSON<{ body:string }>("/api/assist/rewrite", { method:"POST", body: JSON.stringify({ body, tone }) })
}

export async function suggestTitles(body:string){
  return apiJSON<{ titles:string[] }>("/api/assist/titles", { method:"POST", body: JSON.stringify({ body }) })
}

If youâ€™re using Next.js route handlers, stub /api/posts/draft, /api/posts/publish, /api/assist/* nowâ€”they can return canned data during integration.

B) Wire into CherryWriter

components/assistant/CherryWriterModal.tsx (additions)

tsx
import { saveDraft, publishPost } from "@/lib/api/posts"
import { getOutline, rewrite as rewriteApi, suggestTitles } from "@/lib/api/assist"
import { track } from "@/lib/analytics/events"

// Save (explicit + autosave completion)
async function handleSave(){
  setIsSaving(true)
  try{
    const { savedAt: ts } = await saveDraft({ title, body, categories: activeCats })
    setSavedAt(ts ?? Date.now())
    track("writer_save", { len: body.length })
  } finally { setIsSaving(false) }
}

// Publish
async function handlePublish(){
  if (publishDisabled) return
  track("writer_publish", { cats: activeCats, len: body.length })
  const { id, url } = await publishPost({ title, body, categories: activeCats })
  props.onPublish?.({ title, body, categories: activeCats })
  // optional: route to url
}

// Assistant actions
const onAssistAction = async (type: "assist"|"outline"|"rewrite"|"title", payload?:any) => {
  if (type==="outline"){
    const { bullets } = await getOutline(body)
    setBody(b => b + (b ? "\n\n" : "") + bullets.map(bu => `- ${bu}`).join("\n"))
  }
  if (type==="rewrite"){
    const { body: newBody } = await rewriteApi(body, payload?.tone ?? "concise")
    setBody(newBody)
  }
  if (type==="title"){
    const { titles } = await suggestTitles(body)
    if (titles?.length) setTitle(titles[0])
  }
}

Autosave path: you can replace your setTimeout stub with:

tsx
useEffect(() => {
  if (!open) return
  const t = setTimeout(() => { handleSave() }, 800)
  return () => clearTimeout(t)
}, [title, body, activeCats, open])

Acceptance

  • Clicking Save or autosave -> draft API called; â€œSaved Xs agoâ€ updates.

  • Publish calls publish API (only when gating passes).

  • Assistant actions call respective /api/assist/* endpoints and mutate editor content.

3) VirtualFeed for Canopy (using @tanstack/react-virtual)

B) Virtual grid component

components/canopy/VirtualFeed.tsx

tsx
"use client"
import { useMemo, useRef } from "react"
import { useWindowVirtualizer } from "@tanstack/react-virtual"
import InteractiveCherryCard from "@/components/phase2/InteractiveCherryCard"

export default function VirtualFeed({ items }:{ items:any[] }){
  const parentRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement | null>(null)

  // Estimate row height & cols responsively (simple heuristic)
  const cols = useMemo(()=>{
    if (typeof window === "undefined") return 3
    const w = window.innerWidth
    if (w >= 1280) return 4
    if (w >= 768) return 3
    if (w >= 640) return 2
    return 1
  }, [])

  const rows = Math.ceil(items.length / cols)
  const virtualizer = useWindowVirtualizer({
    count: rows,
    estimateSize: () => 320, // average row height
    overscan: 6,
  })

  return (
    <section className="mx-auto max-w-6xl px-4 py-5">
      <div ref={parentRef} className="relative">
        <div style={{ height: virtualizer.getTotalSize(), position: "relative" }}>
          {virtualizer.getVirtualItems().map(vRow => {
            const startIdx = vRow.index * cols
            const slice = items.slice(startIdx, startIdx + cols)
            return (
              <div
                key={vRow.key}
                className="grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-2 md:grid-cols-3 xl:grid-cols-4 gap-5 absolute left-0 right-0"
                style={{ transform: `translateY(${vRow.start}px)` }}
              >
                {slice.map((it:any) => (
                  <InteractiveCherryCard
                    key={it.id}
                    id={it.id}
                    title={it.title}
                    excerpt={it.excerpt}
                    liked={it.liked ?? false}
                    reactionCounts={it.reactionCounts ?? {}}
                    onSave={() => it.onSave?.(it.id)}
                    onLikeToggle={() => it.onLike?.(it.id)}
                    onReact={(key) => it.onReact?.(it.id, key)}
                  />
                ))}
              </div>
            )
          })}
        </div>

2) Keyboard shortcut for Preview (matches label hint)

Add a single key handler in CherryWriterModal.tsx (inside the component, mounted while the modal is open):

tsx
useEffect(() => {
  if (!open) return
  const onKey = (e: KeyboardEvent) => {
    const isMod = e.metaKey || e.ctrlKey
    if (isMod && (e.key.toLowerCase() === "p")) {
      e.preventDefault()
      const next = mode === "preview" ? "compose" : "preview"
      track("writer_preview_toggle", { from: mode, to: next })
      track("writer_mode_change", { mode: next })
      setMode(next)
    }
  }
  window.addEventListener("keydown", onKey)
  return () => window.removeEventListener("keydown", onKey)
}, [open, mode])

Now the UI label â€œPreview (âŒ˜/Ctrl+P)â€ is truthful.

4) Optional: guard Preview shortcut while typing in inputs

tsx
const shouldIgnore = (target: EventTarget | null) => {
  if (!(target instanceof HTMLElement)) return false
  const tag = target.tagName.toLowerCase()
  return tag === "input" || tag === "textarea" || target.isContentEditable
}
// Use inside onKey handler:
if (shouldIgnore(e.target)) return

5) Tiny toast & error banner (quality-of-life)

Toast hook (super-lightweight)

tsx
// lib/ui/useToast.ts
"use client"
import { useState } from "react"
export function useToast(){
  const [msg, set] = useState<string | null>(null)
  const toast = (m: string) => { set(m); setTimeout(() => set(null), 1600) }
  const View = () => msg ? (
    <div className="fixed bottom-4 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 rounded-md bg-black text-white px-3 py-2 text-sm shadow-lg">{msg}</div>
  ) : null
  return { toast, View }
}

Use it in CherryWriterModal.tsx:

tsx
import { useToast } from "@/lib/ui/useToast"
const { toast, View: Toast } = useToast()

async function handleSave(){
  try { /* ... */ toast("Saved") } catch { toast("Save failed") }
}
async function handlePublish(){
  try { /* ... */ toast("Published") } catch { toast("Publish failed") }
}
// At end of modal JSX:
<Toast />

3) API error banner (non-blocking UX)

lib/ui/useBanner.ts

tsx
"use client"
import { useState } from "react"
export function useBanner(){
  const [msg, set] = useState<string | null>(null)
  const [type, setType] = useState<"error"|"info">("info")
  const show = (m:string, t:"error"|"info"="info") => { set(m); setType(t) }
  const View = () => !msg ? null : (
    <div className={`fixed top-2 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 px-3 py-2 rounded-md text-sm shadow
      ${type==="error" ? "bg-red-600 text-white" : "bg-black text-white"}`}>
      {msg}
    </div>
  )
  return { show, View }
}

Use in CherryWriterModal.tsx alongside the toast:

tsx

const { show, View: Banner } = useBanner()

async function handleSave(){
  try { /* ... */ toast("Saved") }
  catch (e:any) { toast("Save failed"); show(e?.message ?? "Save failed", "error") }
}

async function handlePublish(){
  try { /* ... */ toast("Published") }
  catch (e:any) { toast("Publish failed"); show(e?.message ?? "Publish failed", "error") }
}

// at end of modal JSX:
<Banner />
